root.name: > Print Culture and the Modern World

7.name: Children (primary education compulsory; children's press in France 1857)
Women (important readers/writers; Penny magazines, manuals; Jane Austen, Bronte sisters)
Workers (lending libraries, self-improvement, wrote political tracts/autobiographies)

8.name: Power-driven cylindrical press (Richard M. Hoe, 8,000 sheets/hour, useful for newspapers)
Offset press (prints up to six colors)
New sales strategies (Shilling Series, dust cover, cheap paperback editions)
